page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
The following historical information was discovered about our area:- IRON AGE:Berry Mound was a village defended by earth banks and ditches.Today it is"Green Belt"land.
14th Century:Sir Roger Mortimer took the villagers of Solihull Lodge to court.They had destroyed "Mortimer's Banks",an earth bank built to stop people trespassing in the royal hunting woods .The villagers won the case in the end. 17th Century:many timber-framed houses were built and Whitlock End Farm is an example.
19th Century:the Stratford to Birmingham Canal was completed in 1816.
